intro: Earina crassicaulis, commonly known as the broad-stemmed earina, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are broad and fleshy, adapted to store water in arid environments. Earina crassicaulis is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant yellow flowers.
